subject: Entrepreneurship
subcategory: Business Models That Changed the World
title: Direct-to-Consumer: Cutting Out the Middleman
description: A quick win: understand Direct-to-Consumer: Cutting Out the Middleman.

hook.text: Warby Parker sells glasses for $95 that cost the same as $400 frames from Luxottica.

buildup.text: DTC brands skip retailers and sell straight to customers online, keeping margins for themselves.

discovery.text: Without middlemen, DTC brands control pricing, branding, and the customer relationship directly.

twist.text: Many DTC darlings burned cash on ads to acquire customers. Growth was expensive, not free.

climax.text: Casper, Allbirds, and Peloton all went publicâ€”then struggled. DTC alone isn't a moat.

punchline.text: Skip the middleman, but don't forget you still need a moat.

quiz.question: What is the main advantage of the direct-to-consumer model?
options: DTC brands never need to spend money on marketing
Skipping retailers lets brands control pricing and the customer relationship
DTC products are always higher quality than retail alternatives
